column4: so, how do I go about diagnosing my audio problem (no sound:/), nothing is muted in alsamixer (lspci output here: http://pastebin.ca/1426893 )
some commands are aplay -l and aplay -L and a nice script in #alsa
http://pastebin.ca/1426897
that output looks normal.. what happens when you run speaker-test -c 2 -t wav
http://pastebin.ca/1426899 but no sound coming out of speakers
how are your speakers configured?
hm, it's a laptop
oh... hmm does your laptop have a hardware audio switch?
no idea, where is that usually located?
usually they dont exist.... wel anyway can you run alsamixer and make sure stuff isnt muted (like PCM and master)
sometimes if you have headphones plugged in that will also mute there also might be an option in alsamixer for headphone
Yep, nothing is muted in alsamixer. I cant find any audio switch so I guess there is none
run that speaker test constantly and play with alsa mixer untill you find somthing that works..
is anything like surround sound or shared audiop jacks or anything wierd..
and one last question is has the audio ever worked :)
hm, I dont know, I just got this laptop from work dotblank
maybe the audio is disabled in the bios
also try headphoens
I'll check bios
Tried headphones, dont work either
if all else fails you can either try 1. a differant OS, 2. manually adding updated alsa drivers, 3. or get a new laptop (might actually be broken)
